alert.note: Alert for Randolph (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued July 01 at 3:54PM CDT until July 01 at 4:45PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: The National Weather Service in St Louis has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Randolph County in southwestern Illinois... Ste. Genevieve County in southeastern Missouri... Northeastern Madison County in southeastern Missouri... Eastern St. Francois County in southeastern Missouri... * Until 445 PM CDT. * At 354 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Farmington to near Cobalt, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Severe thunderstorms will be near... Fredericktown, Junction City, Cobalt, and Womac around 400 PM CDT. Rocky Ridge, Coffman, and Weingarten around 405 PM CDT. Bloomsdale around 410 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Ste. Genevieve, St. Mary, Chester and Evansville. This includes Interstate 55 in Missouri between exits 141 and 157. This also includes Hawn State Park and Felix Valle House State Park. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
